title: Beet-green Pasta
summary: Beet-green Pastan is a dairy free recipe with 4 servings. One serving contains 785 calories, 21g of protein, and 29g of fat. For $3.52 per serving, this recipe covers 43% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 2 people have made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of bay leaf, olive oil, garlic, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. To use up the pasta you could follow this main course with the Chocolate Dessert Pasta as a dessert. It works best as a main course, and is done in about 25 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 94%. This score is amazing. Try Beet Green and Radish Green Pesto Pasta with Roasted Beets and Radishes, Beet Rice & Garlicky Kale Bowls with Beet Green Pesto, and Golden Beet & Beet Greens Pasta W/ Ricottan and Feta Cheese for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
